review_title: One of the coolest place that you can work for
pros:
1.) Very efficient recruiting process, Bette is definitely the best HR I have ever worked with. She is always pretty responsive, helpful and considerate. I also had a CEO interview for a non-manager role, I can tell this place really respects and values their candidates just from the recruiting process.

2). A lot of delicious snacks, drink, and fruits in the kitchen. They even have some ice creams which I like the most. Free lunch, a lot of choices. You can order delivery with eatclub too when you are too busy to go to the cafeteria.

3). Good for my career. I am working on the platform played by millions of users, this makes me feel very proud. A lot of challenges need to be taken as well, I believe I can learn a lot here.

4). Good work and life balance.

5). Transparent communication. I love my team, they are super smart, easy to get along with and work with.
cons: Nothing particular at this moment.

review_title: Roblox, a place that truly Inspires
pros: It is so wonderful to be surrounded by such great minds - an amazing group of very smart and savvy colleagues. I have learned so much and have grown so much in the last year and half of being at Roblox. Seeing the impact of what we have created in the player community is so exciting and look forward to being apart of the growth at Roblox.
cons: None come to mind.

review_title: Roblox, helping accelerate my career in the right direction
pros: The people are passionate, knowledgeable and fun. Career growth opportunities are endless.
cons: Open concept office can be distracting at times.
advice_to_mgmt: Maintain the unique culture, focus on the most important goals, and continue to crush it!

pros: Fun place to work. Proud to be apart of such an inspiring company. Roblox offers anyone who wants to build games the chance to do so. They provide so much opportunity for young developers to essentially build there own business. It's great to be apart of such a vision!
cons: I do not have any cons to report
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what your doing!

review_title: You will look so cool to your kids
pros: Kids love the product and you should be proud
cons: Kinda startup, but it's been around for a while and codebase was somewhat far from modern.

pros: Great culture where everyone is very helpful and willing to share ideas together. People are hungry to innovate and move the whole platform toward scalability! I've really enjoyed my entire experience from getting recruited, to interviewing, to today.
cons: I don't see any cons thus far
advice_to_mgmt: Invest in infrastructure... the outcome will be happy gammers world wide :)

pros:
- Definitely the people, very friendly and approachable
- Growing fast - a lot of exciting opportunities
- Free food and snacks
cons: - The developer tools are a little outdated but there is focus to improve it now

pros:
- Kitchen is stocked
- Lunch provided
cons:
- Managers intention is not to grow Employees. Lots of politics and if you can play that well, this place wont be suffocating.
- Micro Management
- Funnily when i left, I spoke to HR and told them the reason I am leaving is my manager and the response I got was "You are the 3rd person leaving for the same reason"
- They dont do anything to change the culture of the place. But when they are interviewing you, they provide this amazing picture of the company and culture which is not true.

Would not recommend this place to anyone.

pros: Company is in hyper growth mode. It’s fun being a part of something special and helping build a new category. Company has potential to be the next big thing! Kids get excited when they find out you work for Roblox.
cons: There are so many things to do and sometimes feel like not enough time or resources. The tech stack needs update but we’re working on it.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep hiring the right people.

pros: Decent lunches and snacks. Standing desks. Onsite gym.
cons:
Worst People Ops team I've ever worked with. Non stop gossiping, immature managers who don't know anything about technical recruiting or strategy in closing candidates. I overheard a manager speaking poorly of other companies in an effort to close a candidate and that's just not how you do it. Current People Ops management doesn't know the HR Legal realm and are extremely uneducated in Recruiting and Human Resources practices.

So far, my worst job yet-I left a great company to come to Roblox and it was the worst decision I ever made. I'm currently interviewing at other companies on Roblox's dime. That's how much I can't stand the recruiting team or the company.
advice_to_mgmt: Clean house on the recruiting team. Hire new, competent managers/leads who know how to close candidates without making Roblox look bad, and who are graceful and have class. The current management team lacks education, class and the ability to reduce gossip and keep things confidential.

pros: Nice kitchen. Enjoying all the food, and piggin' out every day. Kids are happy!
cons: Everybody smiles at first, but the company is run by fear. Management terminates a lot of people on a whim, for no reason. Entire teams can be gone in a blink. Pretty much everyone here, especially management, wants to backstab you and make you dispensible in order to let you go easier.
advice_to_mgmt: Stop lying.

pros: Popular products, happy "customers" :)
cons: Unprofessional middle management. New people are hired at higher level while they are nowhere near match for most of the senior engineers. In some cases people with almost zero exp are hired at similar or higher level than people with 10+ years of experience. That's how failed management makes existing employees seek for other opportunities elsewhere.
advice_to_mgmt: Hire down, pick the best to lead. Promote those who consistently deliver good results instead of "promoting" those who just joined.

pros: Great management, opportunities for growth, and people who were really passionate about their work.
cons: Lack of communication between the marketing department and other departments.

pros:
Free lunch
Nice and smart people
cons:
No alignment on company goals
People keeping busy
advice_to_mgmt: Choose what you work on wisely and then execute

pros: People are professional and nice
cons: Promotion is hard, high pressure

pros: Roblox has been the friendliest and most supportive company thus far. It really feel like you have a family of amazing co-workers. This company inspires me to do better and be better everyday.
cons: There are no downsides of working at Roblox, I love everything about this company!

pros: Nice, friendly and supportive teams
cons: There are no cons as far as what I have go through at Roblox

pros:
- Great company culture, everyone is very nice and friendly.
- No "crunch" time. Work hours have been very consistent and normal.
- Free lunch is always nice.
- The work itself has been great.
cons:
- Cross team communication could be improved.
- Sometimes it can be slow to get questions answered from product managers on projects.
advice_to_mgmt: Give ample time on major projects, and make sure the projects are clearly defined.

pros: Everyone is their own "ceo". No one cares how you organize, just so long as it works. I feel empowered to do my job, have excellent benefits, and there is free food everywhere
cons: The teams and offices are growing very quickly so an organic culture has not really revealed itself yet
advice_to_mgmt: Keep it up!

pros: I've been a member of the Roblox community for over 10 years, and getting to contribute to the platform as an engineer is a dream come true! The atmosphere here is very relaxed and vibrant. There's plenty of heads-down work, but it's also common to see people gathered in the snack room for a lively conversation. The work-life balance here is great.
cons: It's unclear to me where my career is headed, and the bay area is very expensive. Roblox pays well, but I'm only barely profiting while living here.

pros: Great place to build a company, great perks, Great people and leaders to work with
cons: Hyper-growth stage, so you should be comfortable with change and rapid peace
advice_to_mgmt: Communication and keep been transparent

pros: Gave me actual responsibilities. Saw my work shipped to the site immediately. Very helpful.
cons: I didn't enjoy the location.

pros:
Moving fast
Lost of opportunities
Lots of perks (401K matching, CalTrain passes, food, drinks, lunches, events, give-aways, time to volunteer)
Nice facilities and equipement
cons: As with many fast moving companies process is lacking and too much knowledge is not written down. It can be hard finding out what you need to know and who to talk to.
advice_to_mgmt: With growth at this speed focus a little more on the onboarding process and documentation to help new hires come up to speed faster and more independently.

pros:
The place is really humming. The kitchens are fully stocked all the time, we get free lunch at the cafeteria on campus, and there are a myriad of benefits available like gym reimbursements and a headphone subsidy. It’s a cool place to work.

As a woman, I feel generally respected and feel things are much better than other tech companies I’ve been at as far as gender inclusion.
cons:
And then here’s the onion: cool place to work while you actually work there.

The company leadership likes to keep things about “values”, which in essence they use to explain away the lack of any sort of structure and tangible leadership. Some of their mottos are “get it done” and “own it”, essentially putting every point of failure on the employee and letting leaders wash their hands of any sort of leadership responsibility.

This leads to an environment where a hot topic among employees across the company is always about who was just let go, or who might be next. Anxiety about the security of their jobs is a common characteristic among the workforce here. Every week there are people let go for who knows what.

Remote work is a huge no-no somehow still in 2018. There is also the PTO scam where there is an unlimited policy merely to make sure there is no obligation to pay employees for the PTO they don’t take, knowing many teams here generally don’t take the time off.

Let’s just say my exhuberance since I started has since worn off in a big way.
advice_to_mgmt:
You’re truly onto something big, and you know it. But you’re also doing it in a way that may come back to hurt you later.

I’m not even sure what advice to give really.

You say you’re transparent, we don’t feel it except in the business sense (yes, you tell us figures but you don’t tell us why our colleagues are snipped).

The valley is small, and people talk. I think the race you’re running is for a successful IPO vs. gathering a reputation of having went through good people to do it.

pros:
- smart people
- fun culture
- interesting problems
cons:
- poor tooling
- need more investment in key areas to improve the company
- lack of clarity in execution
advice_to_mgmt:
- live the values
- continue striving to maintain high quality of life for employees
- champion key initiatives

review_title: Lots of growth and stability in the company
pros: Roblox is growing quickly! The company is financially stable and has the money to expand. The people are friendly and helpful and you have some flexibility to work on stuff that interests you. Benefits are pretty solid too!
cons: Our customers are young, and that can limit what we can do sometimes. It also makes the company for negative press over things that would be ignored if it happened to other companies. There's also not a lot of opportunities to work outside of HQ.

pros:
- Amazing community to work for.
- Kids everywhere know what you do.
- Great challenges to solve.
- Great culture.
- Decent perks.
- Fun people to work with.
- The company is growing very fast.
- The organization is very flat and your ideas are valued.
cons:
- Growing so fast means that there is mounting tech debt.
- The web teams are very dependent on each which is a huge hassle. Although that is changing rapidly.

review_title: Great company that makes frustrating decisions because they are privately-owned and in an impenetrable monopoly.
pros: Flexible structure, modern company, a feeling that you’re a part of something big. Good youthful culture. Roblox is amazing company with tons of amazing people and is a great place to work. Its potential is truly underestimated by the public and the media. This “kid’s platform” has games already competing with top steam titles in terms of player counts and revenue, and it is still growing. Roblox has an incredibly liquid corporate structure and that makes it a fun place for flexible people who like to take initiative to work.
cons: Roblox maintains a virtually impenetrable monopoly due to countless patents and ten years of platform development. That allows senior management to be lazy and make serious mistakes but still the company keeps growing. A lot of the company (mostly business side) doesn’t really have a good grasp of what the platform is. This leads to frustratingly poor business decisions that are completely out of touch with the UGC nature of the company.
advice_to_mgmt: Roblox’s heart and soul is user-generated content. Stop making decisions that push the company away from that. Roblox’s venture into merchandising reeks of last century thinking. For a company that exists by subverting the common practices of the video game industry, seeing it to subscribe to those same practices for merchandising is painful to watch. Kids don’t want to go to Kohl’s to buy generic Roblox-branded shirts... They want shirts from their favorite games, and no one is more suited than to make those than the developers behind those games. In an age when everyone buys everything online, striking a deal with a dying retailer while keeping your content creators completely in the dark is just about the stupidest thing you can do.

pros:
Cool product
Stocked kitchens
Great benefits
Fun off sites
cons:
Lots of politics and lots of churn. They keep their turnover stats low by chopping people quickly. Anyone is dispensable and it turns on a dime.

Lots of micromanaging. No remote work, no flexibility.

PTO is officially unlimited but whether you can take it varies by team
advice_to_mgmt: Treat your teams consistently and don't play favorites.

pros:
- Great team environment
- Everyone is super helpful/friendly
- Snack room is amazing
cons: - No complaints so far

pros: Roblox is a very comfortable place to work at. All usual stuff that you may see at other successful companies are present: snacks, paid meals, flexible/unlimited vacation, 401K matching etc. Personally I chose Roblox over facebook and google not only because I got a better (or matching) offer from Roblox, but also because I felt that I'd be lost in a huge army of Facebook/Google employees possibly working on something not so important. At Roblox I work now on something that instantly affects entire platform and tens of millions of players and I like that. At google/facebook I'd be getting shares that can be sold for cash any moment, however their value is unlikely to increase tenfold over 4 years. With the way Roblox grows I'm fairly confident value of my options will increase more than 10-x over 4 years of vesting period. Yes, Roblox is not a public company, but it's on a good trajectory to become one: we grow consistently over multiple years in revenue, in user count and retention; Roblox just started to expand worldwide and we have a good CEO and top leadership team. I've been at Roblox just a bit less that 2 years and I'm happy that I chose Roblox over all other options when I decided to move to SF Bay area.
cons: Perhaps our release cycle isn't something that I'm happy to deal with or our versioning system. Some senior managers are afraid/not willing to try some ideas, e.g. Roblox is not a small agile start up anymore. So, join us and help us make it better!
advice_to_mgmt: Some software engineers have identical title at Roblox but have uncomparable level of experience and skill. Use measurable metrics to identify those that should be promoted based on these metrics and overall performance and not on number of years worked at Roblox. Otherwise these people might get promotion at other companies.

review_title: Nice people, decent environment, lack of tooling
pros:
Growing like crazy
People generally friendly and smart
Awesome product / kids everywhere will admire you
Good benefits: free lunch, 401(k) match, good insurance
cons:
The company has obviously grown without the influence of an effective CTO:

Since teams are expected to self-organize without a common set of standards, there's a great deal of variance in code quality, hiring process, stack, project management, and titular responsibilities among teams.

Little tooling, and what does exist is nonstandard - everything from pulling source to testing on staging or pushing updates to production is needlessly painful.
Weird restrictions on # of concurrent users accessing staging resources which bottleneck feature development.

Lots of intractable tech debt left over from bad architectural decisions in the past - slower velocity per engineer than many companies in the valley.

Devops and Corp IT are understaffed and lack automated tools for the volume of people they're bringing in.

Culture and advancement glorify tenure over aptitude: some senior people who should be in different roles.
advice_to_mgmt:
Get someone in the C suite who can weave all of these teams together and address the architectural issues. Roblox is a software company and needs someone more empowered than a VP to oversee technology. Having a conductor does not make an orchestra less self-organizing, but lacking one really shows.

Please acquire terminal services licenses for some of the heavily used RDP servers. It will cost less than bottlenecking everyone on the team because only two users are licensed to use an environment at a time.

pros: Competitive salary, free lunch and it’s a gaming company so super fun to play with colleagues and hang out. Collaborative and positive atmosphere.
cons: As of now I don’t see any Con so not sure what to mention here. I guess make the office more appealing and fancy 😀. It looks very simple.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep it up :)

pros: Good pay, Great catered lunches, Good Insurance.
cons: Lots of politics, You can be fired and escorted out without any warning, Don't get too comfortable because they can drop you for no apparent reason.
advice_to_mgmt: Give employees more updates on their work flow. Don't just fire someone without giving them chances for improvement and/or notices to improve.

review_title: Exciting company to work with amazing growth
pros:
The company continues to grow behind strong vision and people. The great culture that values innovation, change, and the community.
Great product, pay, benefits and people with huge amount of room for growth.
Kids loves Roblox.
cons: The company growing very fast.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what you are doing. Appreciate the support, open communication and growth opportunities.

review_title: Unique opportunity to drive key decisions as company grows...
pros: Roblox is in a unique position having built a platform that is widely used and growing across every metric, yet there are so many opportunities for innovation that await exploration. For a product manager, it's a terrific place to be.
cons: The Roblox platform covers a lot of territory - the core multiplayer game engine, messaging systems that connect players, developer tools, a virtual economy, and more. It takes a long time to learn the system and product managers are expected to operate in the details. If you are not up for being very hands on (regardless of your level), this probably isn’t the place for you.

review_title: Exciting Growth, be a hero to kids
pros:
Be a hero to kids everywhere.

Own a product and make a difference. Basically every team has more problems than people. So whatever you build will eventually get to be a world-class version of that "thing". And you get to make it happen.

Core values that are actually valued. They're on the company-issued mugs. People actually talk about them in meetings, in interviews, in performance reviews and when making important decisions.
cons: As a new employee, you can end up "swimming in the deep end" for a while. Roblox is an incredibly complex product with over 10 years of legacy decisions and systems. It's a lot to absorb.
advice_to_mgmt:
Invest more in core services.

IT & Tooling teams are woefully understaffed. New staff onboarding is still painful.

pros: The company already has amazing product-market fit and a killer growth trajectory, although since it's seen as a "kids product", it's very overlooked by tech media. Add to that, the CEO is the boldest thinker I have encountered in 10+ years in tech. He invests the long-term right thing to do over the short-term gimmick every single time, and it has paid off with sustained growth and remarkable technology. Add to that, since it's a "kids product" a lot of the people who work here are parents, which gives the whole place a very mature and work/life friendly vibe. I almost didn't work here because I worried it wasn't "A-list", but I'm very glad I took the offer. I wish I could give 2 thumbs up for the 6-month business outlook. Talent here & comp are just as good as better-known companies, and honestly the upside here is better than most.
cons: It's a fast-growing startup, which means that everyone has to get their hands dirty, and process/org/priorities can change pretty quickly (like, overnight). It's a constant learning curve, and requires a certain amount of go-with-the-flow attitude. Some of the senior leaders are still growing into their level of responsibility.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep focusing on the long-term and doing what's right for customers and employees.

pros: Roblox is a company that is experiencing amazing growth and success right now. The community and user base is passionate and expressive beyond measure. This creates a work environment in which there exist wonderful feedback loops every day, from users and developers who work hard to support the platform and amplify our efforts, to company meetings in which we see our success quantified month over month.
cons:
"Downsides" are always tough to articulate because it forces the implication that something is wrong. Here are some of the things I often share with people I am interviewing to help them complete their picture of the company:

1. Roblox is not a start-up. We have been around for over a decade, and don't always have the agility of a start-up, even though it still feels like a start-up in many other respects.

2. Many, many of our users are kids. This informs all the decisions we make, and in some ways impacts our agility, as we must be much more mindful of the changes we introduce. But as a parent, I am glad to work for a company that takes the issues relating to child safety and security so seriously.

3. Roblox does not make games. We make the platform that others use to make games. This is not a "con" or "downside," but something many don't always realize. In fact, I often say, "what YouTube is for videos and video producers, Roblox is for games and game developers."

4. Roblox values people who work on-site. There are those in the company that work remotely, but it is the exception, not the rule. And while the company is open to discussing individual's needs, and accommodating to personal schedules, from what I see: if you live in the Bay Area, it is highly encouraged for you to come into the office.

review_title: no shortcuts, Roblox has succeeded the hard way
pros: extraordinary technology--for instance, any one of the thousands of game on the Roblox platform could have players on xbox, a tablet device, iphone, android, desktop, etc.--amazing. A few days ago i saw a cutting-edge multi-player game re-implemented on Roblox with astonishing fidelity. The developers who build this technology are sitting all around me--that's perhaps the best thing. Another: it is run by adults. Not by a 25-year old stanford drop-out who just wants to be famous. The codebase here was created deliberately with tender loving care by masters. As a result there seems to be astonishingly little technical debt--eg, on the roblox blog, you can read about major upgrades to the core game components (the physics engine. This would be impossible without a rock-solid code base
cons: about 325 people; there is some bureaucracy, but if you are coming from a larger org, you might have the opposite impression
advice_to_mgmt: keep the standards high during this period of hyper growth

pros:
Great product, awesome benefits, great compensation and getting better. So far, this company is doing a great job listening to the company and continually implementing new ideas, tech, benefits, etc.

Pretty chill environment, too!
cons: None that I can find yet

pros:
Our new building is amazing, free gym access, delicious food.
Working with so many talents and create products that we are all proud of together - everyone here is nice and awesome
Awesome Culture - our CEO is amazing and our team is amazing. My lead always cares about my future career goal and my opinions.
401plans, vision plan, dental plan, reimbursement, free Roblox toys
I am very happy working here and it is like my second home.
cons: Maybe we can have a bonus in future? Everything is awesome to me so far.
advice_to_mgmt: The company is growing fast and we are getting better.

review_title: Great company with lots of potential
pros:
-Ability to accelerate your career - leadership recognizes hard work and talent
-Company as a whole is in rapid growth
-Great perks & benefits (free cal train go pass, free lunches, fitness reimbursement, etc.)
-Brand new office
cons: -With a company in hyper-growth, comes growing pains. At times decisions/ processes change rapidly

pros:
Nice Co-workers
Free Snacks
Decent salary
Management was pretty nice
cons: I'm not sure if I'm the only person who have experienced this or maybe other women have also experience the same thing. I have seen other women getting harassed in the workplace. I have been sexually assaulted in the restroom.

pros: Passionate people who care about the products, the teams and the community. A lot companies claim to have a special culture, Roblox is the real deal. Growing fast but still small enough to feel like you are a part of family and large enough that you feel solid job security and growth opportunities.
cons: There's a shortage of talented engineering leaders and managers to help the company grow to its full potential. But, that's starting to change.

pros:
People team is awesome!
Free lunch every day
Cal Train Go Pass!
401k Plan
Amazing, passionate, talented people everywhere!
cons:
I wanted a windows pc but they gave me a mac.
Work from home policy could be better.
I can't think of any other cons.
advice_to_mgmt: Continue international expansion and put more emphasis on marketing and PR.

review_title: Coolest Place to Work In Silicon Valley
pros: Great management and passionate employees.
cons: The exit off the freeway getting to the building.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the great work.

pros: Brilliant coworkers, visionary leadership, solid work-life balance, fun environment, new office, promising career (and company) trajectory
cons: Very difficult to get in the door
advice_to_mgmt: Continue to stay vision and value oriented

review_title: On it's way to being the best company to work for!
pros:
We have hired some key leaders in the last few months that have really set the standard! Roblox has always had the potential but now I think it's unstoppable!

A few amazing things thus far:
- the new building
-lunch everyday and many options
-medical, dental, vision are top-notch
-countless opportunities to make an impact
cons:
-dated tools
-poor community engagement
(But nothing that can be fixed!)

pros: I have been at Roblox over 2.5 years. It has been an amazing place to work. The people are smart and kind. It is amazing what has been accomplished in the time I have been there!
cons: Not a small company anymore... But it has scaled with grace!
advice_to_mgmt: Keep on doing what you are doing. The leadership team truly cares about the company, and the community!

pros:
Some of the best benefits out there, especially for a start up:

- free lunch 5 days/week (really good food!)
- 401K matching
- top notch medical and dental insurance
- flexible PTO policy
- Wellness stipend
- Caltrain Go Pass
- fun collaborative work environment
- competitive salaries
cons: Company is growing fast. If you don't like change, this isn't the place for you

pros:
- company growth is insane. now is the time to join and be a part of something exciting and huge
- there is a strong push for autonomy and owning your work (huge plus for me)
- people are all around great people
- perks are solid
cons: - a lot of technical debt and catching up to do all around (including processes and general workflow in non-eng capacities). This could be a plus if you like these challenges and want to impact / help scale a company.
advice_to_mgmt:
- definitely feel like we're on the right patch. In support of recent key hires that make us feel like we're properly equipped for the growth
- feels like we're moving too fast at times... I think it's important to prioritize the foundation and investing in infrastructure clean-up too

pros: Great mission, talented people striving to usher the next generation of entertainment! Really competitive benefits, perks, upper level management cares! Opportunity to grow within the company while career development is definite! Culture is unlike anything I have experienced. We are a family here!
cons: Growing at a rapid pace, and with that comes challenges. But these challenges are well worth it and gives us the opportunity to grow as individual contributors.

pros: Amazing culture that is un-matched. While this company is still a start up this is the best group of like-minded , mission driven/focused individuals I have ever had the pleasure of meeting. Great perks as well, and usually it is you get either great perks and a not so great company culture/environment or you get the great culture with no perks. You without a doubt get the best of both worlds.
cons: Accelerated growth - although, not necessarily a con.

review_title: Amazing company I had no idea about
pros:
-> Great People
-> Exploding Growth
-> Product you can be proud of
-> Outstanding benefits (Food, Caltrain, Etc.)
-> Brand new office
cons: -> The Commuter bus near Caltrain sometimes isn't there and you have to walk from the station to the office, but not a major factor

pros: Working with people you like makes work a ton better!
cons: The coffee is keurig :(

review_title: My manager is supportive with my career growth and is coaching me along the way
pros: Great work environment. It can get loud at times due to the open floor plan, but we get reimbursed $300 for noise canceling headphones! We just moved into a new spot, so the building is beautiful and big. My manager is supportive with my career growth and is coaching me along the way.
cons: We're growing at a rapid speed - running out of space.. but luckily we will eventually expand to have an additional building.

pros: Friendly and pleasant working environment
cons: Job division and content is not very organized, but it was also the time for the company to grow and scale fast

pros: Because, Roblox is great !!!
cons: Great!! I'm loving it!!!! WOW!!!!😎😎😎😎😎😎😎
advice_to_mgmt: Happy Holidays! 2k17 Christmas 5 days left!!! Roblox is GREAT!!!!

pros:
Good culture
So many talented people and they are very passionate about their work
Work-life balance
REAL unlimited paid vacations
Colleagues from different teams are very supportive
Happy working environment
Many free snacks
Free meals and happy hours
cons: Fast growing makes some processes a bit slow.

pros:
Well, first of all, they have some really nice and efficient recruiters here. Thanks to Stacey Ruderman and Bette Vu, the interview is surprisingly fast. As far as I can tell, they will try everything to help the candidate easy their nerve and do their best during the interview process.
For people who prefer a little diversity, this is a great place to work. I have meet people from differrent places with a veriaty of backgrounds here. I think anyone pays attention to others could learn a lot.
And folks here are always ready to help others out. They will lend me a hand form small questions like forgetting my password to alittle trickier ones like messed up with Pforce.(Please be more forgitive, I am new here).
cons: Something wrong with the water machine, I have press pretty hard and only a tiny little stream of water was flowing into my cup. Unhappy about that.

pros:
- Better snack kitchen than Facebook
- Great benefits
- Unlimited time off (for real)
- Opportunity to make big impacts
- Company is on track to become huge
- New office!
cons:
- Poor community engagement
- Dated tools
- Little to no investment in development process, lots of dumb bugs as a result
- Massive divide between departments causes friction
- Commitment to backwards compatibility forever harms the platform
- No prioritization of power user needs

pros:
- Fast growing company
- Smart CEO
cons:
- Building
- Salary not competitive for a company of its size
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the good work

pros: Lots of great benefits, cooperating with staff is amazing due to the company welly training them. Also when I get a project finished, everyone gets to collaborate, and get to share their own opinions.
cons: During a project, we have to put up hours of trial and error because of size references, different likings, and color matching with the product.
advice_to_mgmt: It would be a great opportunity if you are well at cooperating, knowing your surroundings, and other people's likings.

pros: It's fun plus a lot of money
cons: Loads of people and kind of boring
advice_to_mgmt: Idk

pros:
- Unlimited stored kitchen
- Nice co-workers
- Great experience
cons:
- Old building
- Small offices
advice_to_mgmt: Make the offices bigger and re-building the HQ.

pros:
Nice, smart people. Haven't run across any jerks.
Cool product making a positive impact.
Clear vision from top leadership about what we're trying to do.
Unlimited PTO
Generous pay
I really like my manager
cons: Code, tools, processes all old. A lot of time lost on everything but development (fighting with tools, trying to understand old code, etc).
advice_to_mgmt: Invest in infrastructure. We are moving at half speed (or worse) because we are saddled with so much technical debt.

pros: A lot of snacks in the kitchen. A lot to learn and explore. Co-workers are all very bright and hardworking. If you able to last in the companies for years, means you have been delivering.
cons: Work is extremely fast paced and demanding. Have to deliver result on a daily basis. Be prepared to stay late if there's emergency, even on weekend. Recruiter low balled my salary, even though I have close to 20 years of experience. My salary is lower than my previous job.

pros: The people I worked with were nice enough.
cons: The superiors are antagonizing and push everyone to work extra hours with little to no extra pay. Yelling is usually heard from them.

review_title: Best company I've ever worked for
pros:
Work-life balance
Competitive pay
REAL unlimited paid vacation
Nice location
Have so many talented people
Great team and colleagues
Have projects in different areas that you can learn a lot if you're en Engineer
Reimbursement for parking, commuting and gym
401k
Free snacks
Free meals
cons: It's getting larger so things are sometimes a little bit slow to be processed

pros: Fast-paced, full of intelligent people with very strong passion in what they are doing, you can feel their level of positive energy.
cons: The company is still in the growing mode so there are still things needed to improve especially the process.
advice_to_mgmt: The management team is doing a great job, what they are doing is working really well to get us where we are right now.

pros: all workers were great and very friendly
cons: space was sorta small for a big buisness

pros: The best job experience I ever had. The crew is amazing and everyone gets along.
cons: Change in some people's attitudes but not bad at all

pros: Great Teamwork, communication, and commitment.
cons: I'd consider the community, terrible.
advice_to_mgmt: None

review_title: The best company I've ever worked so far
pros: Work/life balance is outstanding. I'm used to put 60 hour weeks routinely, but at Roblox I work normal business hours. No outsourcing. The founders built the company with a thought that they want to enjoy working there and want others to feel the same. They've wonderfully succeeded. People really have fun at work. Ideas are encouraged. Management always looks to optimize feedback channels, so they can hear everyone. Startup with no strings attached. Greatly profitable, currently growing at outstanding rate. Talented people around, great technologies to work with. Great medical & FSA benefits
cons: The office is in an old building. A/C's are noisy, you can see lots of odd piping going through the rooms. C-management keeps their grip on all decisions made. Sometimes you may find it tough to work with them. Though, you feel respected anyway.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what you're doing. So far it looks awesome.

pros: Future outlook looks very good. Not much pressure from direct management as long as you do your job well. You will work on something unique that users love.
cons: Even though it's located at the heart of San Mateo downtown the office looks a bit outdated for a tech company. It's difficult to push through ideas.
advice_to_mgmt: There should be more strict management :)

review_title: Fun and challenging place to work
pros: Great thriving office with a lot of creative energy and passion. Everyone is extremely talented and open to sharing or helping. The company really values and support the people that pursue their passions and provide feedback. Management is also very good at acknowledging good performance/highlights. It's occupying a very exciting spot in gaming where its leveraging a huge catalog of content in conjunction with cutting edge technology.
cons: With such a supportive environment, there are occasions where you really have to speak up to be heard. This may be difficult for people who are a little more soft spoken or timid.
advice_to_mgmt: Career and personal goals usually fall off the radar mid quarter as work loads pick up and things get placed on the back burner.

pros: All kinds of free snacks, including ice cream, surrounded by different dev kits, helpful teammates and good management. Can work on my own side project when the main tasks are done.
cons: The company outlook can be improved and the building is old. Should clean up the workplace if possible. WFH is impossible.
advice_to_mgmt: We should move to a better place when the company is bigger and has more revenues.

pros:
- opportunity for growth
- free snacks
- all other perks of bay area company
cons: - No employee bonuses

review_title: Not the right place for a career
pros: Free snacks are all I can think of.
cons:
High turnover rate
Salary is not competitve with the cost of bay area living
HR does nothing and looks the other way when complaints are made
Very old building with bad A/C and leaky ceilings
Poor facilities management
Managers will throw associates under the bus when they can't handle their own job or stress
Encouragement for growth is more talk then acted upon
A lot of great hard-working employees have been let go due to manager egos
CEO gives other people credit for the work you perform
Healthcare coverage is not the best
advice_to_mgmt: Pay closer attention to the managers you put in charge of your departments. Pay your employees fairly for the work they perform regardless of their job title. Surveys mean nothing if you don't intend to fix the things employees are unhappy about. The fact that most of your company consists of people who have not been there more than a few years should tell you something.

pros: Working on the future of play and entertainment. Great people. Big vision. Accelerating growth. Interesting market. Leverage from user generated content.
cons: We are toolmakers more than content creators. Not the best place for people who want to be making games, unless they are interested in building the tools, infrastructure and environment where the ROBLOX dev communicty can build great games.

pros: Great health care options, competitive salary, and competent executive staff.
cons: No 401(k) matching for employees earning something considered a competitive salary in the Bay Area.

pros: THERE ARE NO PROS ABOUT WORKING AT ROBLOX!!!
cons: In the job description they said they would offer free snacks. On the other hand... I walk to the kitchen and find no snacks whatsoever...
advice_to_mgmt: You suck

pros: Cutting edge Virtual Reality. People really care about what they are doing. User Generated Content Leader. This company is truly redefining entertainment. I feel like I am at the epicenter of cool!
cons: This company is exceptionally well suited for me. I find the quirks that others might find to be a con to be endearing.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what you are doing. There is an opportunity for feedback very often through Tiny Pulse. This truly gives every employee the power to change the company. Feedback from the staff feels valued!

pros: Friendly, casual, comfortable and open about information
cons: lots of politics, asking without asking, connections and projects that go nowhere
advice_to_mgmt: Users always balk at changes, that doesnt mean they need to be rolled back

pros:
ROBLOX got amazing Technology Stack that can help you gain immense knowledge in C/C++/iOS/C#/Android.
Smart employees.
cons: Senior Leadership need to recognize employees who delivers, instead Senior Leadership rewards employees who listens to them and showcases their work.

pros: Very enthusiastic and passionate company. Great engineering team, and high company morale. Little red tape to get things done, and overall just very mature but also very dynamic. Loved the atmosphere and culture.
cons: Office was a bit small considering the number of people they had. But being located in the middle of downtown San Mateo was certainly a big plus.

pros:
Wide variety of products to work on - Roblox is building Amazon + AWS + Unity
Strong technical team
Fast moving culture - multiple deploys to production daily
Lots of transparency from executives
cons:
A lot of micro-management
Unclear how to "win" this market
Unwilling to fit into "new-style" of tech company

review_title: Great place with lots of smart people
pros:
- I never run out of things to do
- I am constantly learning, every single day,
- The people here actually care for your well-being/work life balance, etc..
- Awesome benefits - commuter/free lunches/gym membership
- Very tight knit group of people who are very intelligent
cons: - Difficult at times due to not many processes being set-up/constant change of processes, but you get used to it, and can give you a chance to step up and take charge, which is new to me.

review_title: We work together toward common goals
pros: I love the transparency of the company from the lowest levels to the highest. It makes for an easier time for collaboration and for wanting to get things done. It is a challenging environment with little room for downtime (I've always found challenges to be a good thing) leading to consistent individual growth. The people are amazing and there is a common theme among everyone: being the BEST!
cons: Still a young company needing improvement in processes, which makes some challenges more challenging than necessary. But management is aware and are consistently making improvements.
advice_to_mgmt:
Keep improving on really listening to your employees. Take time to understand where they're coming from when dealing with a work-related problem. If you can't give them what they want, fully explain why in a way they'd understand so that they don't come out of the conversation more frustrated or confused.

Other than that, you're making ROBLOX a GREAT place to work. :)

pros: You're surrounded by highly intelligent people, no matter where you work. There's an attitude of work hard, play hard. Hard work pays off here. A lot of heads down, hard at work during work hours, but people relax and have good time at social events and during catered lunches.
cons: There are high expectations of everyone. You have to keep performing, and performing at a high rate. You can get burned out easily here if you're not up to it.
advice_to_mgmt: Show appreciation for things more often. It doesn't have to be a big announcement at an all hands meeting, but recognize the hard work and small successes more often than you do.

review_title: Great Experience, fast pace, plenty opportunities
pros:
Team is fairly small and get to have more chances to work on the interesting projects; company is growing fast and gives more responsibility; coworkers are usually very intelligent, nice and supportive, can't ask for more in terms of colleagues.

Flexibility of work time; good holiday vacation and unlimited PTO; robust medical; convenient parking; company lunch is normally good; snacks are good and always in stock.

Company-wide meeting every Tuesday where you can ask CEO any question, and employee are always keep posted of company decisions and outlook; higher level are usually easy to talk to and get informed.
cons:
Working environment can be more open and collaborative, and some entertainment facility like fooseball/table tennis would be nice.
No business card is given, it could be a great/cheap way to introduce and promote the company.
advice_to_mgmt: It could be better to make more adaptive changes to the product and increase the revenue and move to a better office!

pros:
Great concept and application
Good staff and smart people
Pleasant work environment
cons:
Like most online game companies the life work balance is wonky. Some changes as their core workers grow up and more have families.
They really need to look at their QA prices session and actually create a team to QA things beyond having the programmers check their own code
advice_to_mgmt:
Stop rushing new things
QA new programming and features beyond just is working, I.E. Stress test it, look for holes, and start thinking like your worst hackin customers for possible exploits. You won't catch everything but you will stop a lot of the exploits and cheating that your users complain about most. Give your users the tools to block others individually to cut down on bullying and other bad behaviors

pros:
Easy access to Caltrain
Company perk of free parking
Equally oppressed coworkers (so you can commiserate)
cons:
You are treated like a drone
Upper management doesn't seem to care about the users
Gaming company mentality of not valuing its own employees
advice_to_mgmt: Think about the kids using Roblox as if they were your own.

review_title: Amazing people with a great vision and engineering discipline
pros:
This is the most professional gaming company I have ever worked at, David, Keith, Matt everyone just oozes profesionnalism. None of that big ego stuff you find at other gaming companies, at Roblox people come to work to do their best and to be efficient at doing it.

The Roblox game environment is a 24x7 host solution and yet OT hardly ever occurs why? Because the system was engineered to be robust and scalable, and what is probably even more important the alert and notification system doesn't bug you at first sign of problems, it actually has some intelligence to it such that you only get paged when things are really suspect/bad.
cons: Not sure if I should put it down as a 'con' but Roblox is still a young start-up their policies and benefits are not as elaborate as you will find at other companies.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep going and kick some a..!

pros: Good for gamers and programmers
cons: Don't care about employees. Poor management. High turnaround. Poor lighting in the office/ bad office space.
advice_to_mgmt: CEO is a absolute control freak. Let people do their jobs and stop trying to humiliate people.

pros: I have no Pros. Roblox isnt what it used to be.
cons: Overworking staff, doesn't care to listen to employees or even users of the game, low pay
advice_to_mgmt: Make the product better

review_title: Ability to affect millions of people with every improvement you make
pros:
- Work environment is definitely product focussed
- Technology used to do beautiful things
- Growing
cons: - Sometimes repetitive free lunches - let's mix it up!
advice_to_mgmt: Keep the focus on the product and technology - media and advertisers will be pulled along

review_title: Lots of smart people, great vision, big market
pros:
-Lots of room for new ideas. The tech is fairly new and broad, and there is minimal bureaucracy and approval "processes".
-Talent is rewarded.
-Smart coworkers
-Transparency about company strategies all the way from exec level. Company meetings every week where all details of the business and financials are discussed.
cons: -This company isn't great for people who are just out of school. The expectation is that you take educating and training yourself into your own hands, which could be a bit of a challenge to some. If you do not possess the knowledge and the talent to be a good problem solver, don't expect management to train you on solving things.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep it up!

review_title: One of the nicest launching pads
pros: Your coworkers? For the most part are amazing. Sure there's always going to be some people you don't get along with but that's the same anywhere. They really take your needs into consideration and if you prove to them you're a hardworker, they'll treat you like family.
cons: Underpaid depending on where you're living, no benefits yet but last I heard we were looking into some options there, almost guaranteed that you will work holidays.
advice_to_mgmt: Overall we tended to get more negative feedback and harsh reminders that we should have a handle on things. Instead of just pressuring us to work harder and faster I liked the few days where we were told to just stay calm, don't rush anything, and keep things steady. Focus more on the positive side.

review_title: Good, positive company with the great potential.
pros: New technologies; fast pace; great potential.
cons: Constant delivery without checking for quality. No offices (open space and noise)
advice_to_mgmt: cubicles may improve productivities.

review_title: High-growth, high-learning environment that demands that I continuously up my game
pros: Very fun product, amazing group of peers, diverse technology stack, and a broad range of problems to solve and opportunities to pursue. ROBLOX is a real meritocracy, where hard work, passion, and results win over everything else. You're constantly learning, and constantly improving. People are well rewarded and praised. I see some negative comments on this site about retention, but retention has been great from what I see, and we've doubled in size in less than one year.
cons: I think there are downsides for those who cannot adapt quickly, who are not flexible, or who are not able to consistently deliver. For these people, ROBLOX can be a challenge. ROBLOX can also be a tough place for those uncomfortable with a narrowly focused, highly iterative approach -- employees must be able to tolerate off-scope ideas being placed on the sidelines, and having interim results being "works in progress". From what I hear, ROBLOX is no different than other dynamic and successful tech companies.

review_title: Fast growth with lots of upside
pros:
People who show initiative get the opportunity to lead teams.
Good balance between work and vacation (or flexible work hours).
Fast-paced releases, so you are able to see the impact on numbers.
Brilliant engineers, so you work with the best.
cons:
Ramping headcount quickly, so you've gotta be able to swim with the group or be left behind.
Didn't have healthcare, but offering it soon.
advice_to_mgmt: hire more senior people to manage the growth.

review_title: Company can't keep their best human resources.
pros: Some of the best software engineers with expertise in innovative process
cons: High turn around of key employees and a general "we don't care" attitude about it. This attitude from the management reflects on the moral of the people working for the company.
advice_to_mgmt: Management keep useless meeting going to feel good about themselves. Saying " I will be honest with you" doesn't mean you are!

pros: - Great culture and company outlook.
cons: - Management chaotic since company grew really quickly

pros: Great network of employees and good culture
cons: Company is going through some growing pains.

pros: It's one of the best jobs
cons: It's good management and great people
advice_to_mgmt: I would need a new account

review_title: Very challenging work environment, you have to be on your toe every day
pros:
- Great Technology
- Flexible hours
- Good Health Benefits
cons:
- Open Cubicle
- Too much pressure
- Recognition goes to the same set of people, it matters who stays up late & BRAGS, than who gets the work done.
- Keeping quiet will not help, you need to be vocal about your accomplishments day in & day out.
advice_to_mgmt: Looks at the deliverables of each & every individual, not from the perspective of bragging rights, pre conceived ideas & your personal attachments. You will notice there are several individuals who does not brag but get the work done with quality.

pros: Small company. Everyone has a voice in product decisions. Non-stressful working environment, yet intense passion in employees.
cons: Long term vision can be lacking. Product is constantly optimizing, which can be frustrating and leave you a bit ungrounded.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep transparency inside the company. You have a lot of talented employees who should not be overlooked. Also keep taking risks.

pros: Kids really love the product, and the social network that goes around it. Co-workers are smart, generally hard-working, and capable.
cons:
CEO business management understanding and sales strategy is clearly not strong. David Baszucki has rather poor people skills.

It's a untrusting environment to be in everday and is very draining -- inefficient work flow because the CEO is a super control freak.
advice_to_mgmt: Let some of the smart people on the team do their jobs, while you focus on being the CEO.

pros: Fast paced development with brilliant people. Fun, rewarding work atmosphere. Great location close to downtown Redwood City. Your ideas matter!
cons: Development changes direction occassionally, but probably for the better!
advice_to_mgmt: More margaritas!
